name: Spiced Maple Pumpkin Seeds
author: ekgjester
summary: Roasted seeds that don't splinter as much and have a deep rich flavor.  A great snack!
ingredients: 2 cups raw whole pumpkin seeds, washed and dried
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper
In a large skillet over medium-low heat, melt the butter, then stir in the seeds
Cook, stirring constantly, until the seeds turn slightly brown in color, about 10 minutes
Drain off any excess butter, and stir in the cinnamon, nutmeg, and maple syrup until the seeds are thoroughly coated with spices
Spread the seeds out onto the prepared baking sheet
Bake in the preheated oven until crisp and golden brown, stirring every 10 minutes, for 30 to 45 total minutes of baking time
